home.solution_text: DJI Agriculture not only empowers agriculture professionals with powerful equipment but also provides intelligent solutions that save time and increase workflow, benefiting a wide range of customers from farmers and growers to agricultural cooperation and service agencies.
home.explore_card1_text: Witness ordinary people exceeding their harvest goals thanks to our Agricultural solutions.
home.explore_card2_text: Are you interested in ridding your fields of insects like Panonychus citri (McGregor) with DJI Agriculture Drones? Find out more.
home.explore_card3_text: DJI’s agricultural project has generated over 30,000 new jobs and is committed to strengthening the agriculture industry and benefiting farmers everywhere.
home.support_text3: Learn about after-sales services and technical support.
home.contact_us_text: If you wish to purchase products or become a dealer, please leave your contact information below. We will be in contact with you shortly.

card.card1_title: High-precision Plant Stand Count for Corn, Sunflower and Sugar Beet by a Drone and AI
card.card1_text: Plant stand count is an essential task in yield management. It allows growers to estimate the plant population, density, germination rate, and plant health and make timely decisions that finally affect the yield.
card.card2_title: New DJI Agriculture Drone Insight Report Reveals Greater Acceptance, Advanced Farming Techniques and Exploration of Best Practices for Farmers
card.card3_title: What does agricultural drone spraying of 66.7 million hectares mean to the planet?
card.card5_text: Our solutions provide digital, informative, intelligent, and precise field management for grain crops such as rice, wheat, and corn. This empowers agricultural operators with more convenient and efficient options, reduces operation costs, improves crop quality, and increases yield rate.
card.card6_text: We also provide digital, informative, intelligent, and precise management solutions for commercial crops such as cotton, citrus trees, apple trees, and tea plants. As with grain crops, agoperators will find these options more convenient, inexpensive, and beneficial to crop quality and yield rate.
